scenarios.hook: POV: You're on a call with your mom's doctor while your kid needs homework help
chaos_moments: 7:15am - Pack lunches while texting siblings about Dad's appointment
9:30am - 'Sorry can you repeat that doctor, my son just—'
12:00pm - Eat lunch standing up checking Mom's medication tracker
3:45pm - School pickup → straight to Dad's physical therapy
6:00pm - 'Mom, I'll call you back, dinner's burning'
scenarios.punchline: And somehow everyone still asks 'so what do you DO all day?'

scenarios.hook: POV: You're the emergency contact for literally everyone
chaos_moments: School nurse: 'Your daughter has a fever'
Dad's facility: 'He fell, nothing serious but...'
Your mom: 'The TV isn't working and I'm scared'
Teenager: 'Mom where are you I NEED you right now'
Doctor's office: 'Can you come in to discuss test results?'
scenarios.punchline: Your phone battery dies and you have a full panic attack

scenarios.hook: POV: Sunday family dinner is a military operation
chaos_moments: Cut up Dad's food while helping with science project
Remind Mom to take her pills between soccer snacks
Mediate fight between grandpa and teenager
Explain TikTok to grandma while checking homework
Clean up while everyone else relaxes
scenarios.punchline: Monday feels like a vacation in comparison

scenarios.hook: POV: You realize you haven't sat down all day
chaos_moments: 6am - Help Dad with his morning routine
7am - Make breakfast for three generations
8am - Drive kids to school, parents to appointments
11am - Grocery shopping for everyone's dietary restrictions
2pm - Pick up prescriptions and school supplies
scenarios.punchline: Your fitbit congratulates you on 20,000 steps. You haven't left town.

scenarios.hook: POV: Your search history is absolutely unhinged
chaos_moments: 'How to explain death to a 7-year-old'
'Best grab bars for shower safety'
'Why won't my teenager talk to me'
'Memory care vs assisted living'
'How to not lose your mind sandwich generation'
scenarios.punchline: The algorithm is very confused about your life stage

scenarios.hook: POV: You're interpreting between generations at dinner
chaos_moments: Kid: 'Grandpa is being sus'
You: 'She means you're acting suspicious, Dad'
Grandpa: 'Back in my day we didn't need safe spaces'
You: 'He's talking about your bedroom, honey'
Everyone stops eating to stare at you
scenarios.punchline: You've become a generational Google Translate

scenarios.hook: POV: Your car is a mobile pharmacy/daycare/taxi
chaos_moments: Backseat: juice boxes and pill organizers
Front seat: permission slips and insurance forms
Glove box: band-aids and anxiety medication
Cup holders: coffee from 3 days ago
Radio: toggling between pop music and talk radio
scenarios.punchline: The drive-thru pharmacist knows your voice

scenarios.hook: POV: You're trying to have ONE adult conversation
chaos_moments: Mom starts talking about her doctor visit
Kid interrupts needing help with math
Dad calls confused about his medication
Other kid has friendship drama emergency
Mom forgets what she was saying
scenarios.punchline: You give up and just nod at everyone

scenarios.hook: POV: Bedtime routines are a multi-generational event
chaos_moments: 8pm - Kid's bedtime story while checking Dad's blood sugar
8:30pm - Tuck in child, help Mom with nighttime pills
9pm - Read to grandpa, check teenager did homework
9:30pm - Everyone's finally settled
10pm - Someone needs water/bathroom/anxiety relief
scenarios.punchline: You collapse into bed fully clothed like a cartoon

scenarios.hook: POV: Your vacation planning needs a spreadsheet
chaos_moments: Find place with wheelchair accessibility
Check if they allow service dogs
Verify nearby urgent care facilities
Pack enough medication for small army
Plan activities for ages 8 to 80
scenarios.punchline: A weekend at home sounds more relaxing

scenarios.hook: POV: You're googling 'is this normal' for multiple age groups
chaos_moments: 'Is it normal for 75-year-olds to forget names?'
'Is it normal for 13-year-olds to hate everyone?'
'Is it normal to cry in grocery store parking lots?'
'Is it normal to feel guilty about everything?'
'Is it normal to want to run away and join the circus?'
scenarios.punchline: The answer to the last one is definitely yes

scenarios.hook: POV: You realize you're becoming your mother
chaos_moments: Carrying snacks for everyone in your purse
Knowing everyone's medical history by heart
Saying 'because I said so' unironically
Worrying about everyone constantly
Making the same facial expressions she does
scenarios.punchline: And honestly? She was pretty amazing at this job
